meanings.definition: Stones collected from fields and used in construction.
meanings.sent1: The farmer gathered fieldstone to build a sturdy wall around his property.
meanings.sent2: The old barn was made of fieldstone, giving it a rustic look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat tried to eat the fieldstone, thinking it was a giant rock candy.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt heavy as if burdened by the weight of fieldstone.
meanings.sent5: The children skipped along the path lined with fieldstone, feeling the rough texture under their feet.

meanings.definition: A stone found in a field.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist discovered an ancient fieldstone while excavating the site.
meanings.sent2: The kids played hide-and-seek among the fieldstone scattered across the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The fieldstone rolled down the hill, surprising the grazing cows below.
meanings.sent4: His mind was as solid and unyielding as a fieldstone, resistant to change.
meanings.sent5: The fieldstone glistened in the sunlight, a hidden gem in the grassy expanse.
